Name: Stela of Baal-mont
Description: The decorated surface is divided into two registers. The first depicts the mummiform Osiris seated on a block throne on the left. He is holding a was-sceptre in his hands. In front of him stand a man and a woman, both making the gesture of adoration. Above the figures are three columns of text. In the lower register is a couple sitting on stools. The man is holding a lotus flower to his face. In front of him are two kneeling men, each holding a lotus flower. Underneath them is an offering table. The accompanying texts are placed above and between the figures.
